item.description:
We held this event several years ago and it was a huge success so we're doing it again !

Come join us for the Secret Santa Paws celebration.  We will be holding this year's event at the Barking Dog facility in Hooksett.  We have rented two large rooms there for a two hour period (3 to 5 pm) so there will be plenty of space for the dogs to run around and have a blast.

 

The cost is $2 per family [a group of related person(s) and their dog(s)] Carole Rudman will be collecting money at the door so please be sure to pay her either before the event or upon entrance.  This money is to cover the rental fee for the facility.

 

 

 

Here's how this event works:

When you sign up,  answer the rsvp questions about your dog's name, breed,  size and favorite things or wishlist.  Enrollment period for this event ends on December 29th.  This is to make sure everyone has ample time to do their Secret Santa Paws shopping !

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

After the enrollment period,  the chief Elf will pull names from a christmas stocking and send out emails to all participants notifying them as to which pooch they are gifting at the party.

 

 

 

 

 

Bring your pooch gifts and food to the party and be prepared for loads of  FUN FUN FUN !!!

 

 

This is a potluck event and we are suggesting finger type foods.  Melodie is organizing the pot luck food so please notify her as to what you are bringing.  Here are some suggestions for what to bring:


  • Chips and dips or salsas
  • cheese and crackers
  • cookies
  • brownies
  • fudge
  • cut fruit
  • potato skins
  • shrimp cocktail and sauce
  • Paper goods (napkins, plates, cups)
  • Plastic utensils
  • Doggie Treats
  • Hot Apple Cider
  • Sodas
  • Water

 


 

 

 

 

 

Carole has volunteered herself and Debbie Coogan as chief pooper scooper picker-uppers.

Carole is also collecting money at the door (or prior to the event)

Melodie is in charge of organizing the Potluck Food

Judi is handling music for the afternoon and will serve as chief Elf and Santa's Helper

 

It would be great if we could also have some nice decorations for the party.  If you would like to volunteer to help with this event,  please notify Judi-Judi-Judi.

 

Any questions,   just ask the chief elf, yours truly,  Judi-Judi-Judi

Any suggestions from the peanut gallery,  you can also send those to the chief elf.

Hope to see you all on January 13th for a fantastic party.

 

Woof woof woof.......woof woof woof.........woof wooooooof woooof woof woof !

(sung to the tune of Jingle Bells)

 

PS -  The gifting is only a secret until the party.  Feel free to put your name on the present so the recipient knows who to thank.

group.name: Human Soles & Doggie Paws Hikers & Walkers of Manchester, NH

item.name: Secret Santa Paws
